attributes.action: Meat tax to fund research for lab grown meat
attributes.additional_details:
Some recent articles discussing a meat tax, all noting that the meat industry contributes 15 per cent of the world's emissions:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/meat-tax-would-be-supported-by-public-eventually-report-claims-a6746866.html
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/greenpolitics/taxandtheenvironment/12012836/Tax-meat-global-warming-Chatham-House-report.html http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2015/nov/24/meat-tax-far-less-unpalatable-than-government-thinks-research-finds
attributes.background: For both environmental and ethical reasons, there is good reason to speed up the transition from eating animals to eating meat that has been grown in a laboratory. By adding a meat tax, and using the revenue generated to fund research on lab grown meat, we can do just that.
